info.title: SuperOffice Agent API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

post.summary: Method that returns a specified number of document appointments within a time range, filtered by document template type.
post.description:
The document appointments belong to the contact specified. 
NsApiSlow threshold: 2000 ms.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: ContactId, StartTime, EndTime, Count, DocumentTemplateId

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

post.summary: Updates the existing DocumentEntity or creates a new DocumentEntity if the id parameter is 0.
post.description:
Save the document entity. If the entity already exists and the file name of the incoming entity is different from the existing one, a corresponding renaming of the physical document will be attempted. This may cause an amended file name to be substituted into the document entity, since a document plugin may have aribitrary rules on file names and collisions. Clients should always inspect the return value from this call and not assume that what they sent for saving is the final truth.
NsApiSlow threshold: 2000 ms.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentTemplat.description:
The template a document is based on is stored in the SO_arc\template folder on the server. This will return the name as displayed in the GUI, and not the physical document name, of the template the document object is based on.

Services for the DocumentTemplate Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IListAgent">List Agent</see>.

SaveInDb.description: 1 = save document records in DB; otherwise not.

DefaultOref.description: Processed via tag substitution to give document reference

RecordType.description: 1 = app, 2 = doc, 3 = email, 4 = fax, 5 = phone, 6 = todo - see EAppntRecordTypes

Deleted.description: 0 -> record is active 1 -> record is 'deleted' and should not be shown in lists

AutoeventId.description: Which document plugin is responsible for the documents generated from this template

QuoteDocType.description: What type of quote document is this.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.
Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TemplateVariabl.description:
Parameters specifying source and properties for template variable substitution.
<para />
Carrier object for TemplateVariablesParameters.
Services for the TemplateVariablesParameters Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IDocumentAgent">Document Agent</see>.

SourceInput.description: Source string to parse for template variables. Such variables must have delimiters corresponding to the standard for the given generator encoding.Non-text source data (such as the binary content of a .doc file) should be passed in as Base64.

Encoding.description: Encoding of source string. Non-text formats such as MsWord or Excel should be Base64 encoded in the source string.

CultureName.description: Name of culture to be used for culture-sensitive data, such as dates or multi-language texts. Use a blank string to accept current culture that is set on the server.

CustomTags.description: Array with custom tags and values. Array may be of unlimited height, but need to be exactly 2 in width.

DocumentEntity.description: Custom document entity to use for data retrieval. Useful for unsaved data.  DocumentEntity.DocumentId need to match the DocumentId specified in separate property.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.description: Partial DocumentEntity class associating the generated DocumentEntity with an interface.

UpdatedBy.description: The person that last updated the appointment.

CreatedBy.description: The person that first created the document. The property is read-only.

OurRef.description: Our reference, searchable field from freetext search

Description.description: The actual text, max 2047 significant characters even though it is stored as a larger data type on some databases

DocumentTemplate.description:
The template type of the document. 
<para>Use MDO List name "doctmpl" to get list items.</para>

Person.description:
A document may also be connected to a person; this must be a contact person registered on the current company. This does not mean however that a person is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "person" to get list items.</para>

Associate.description:
The owner of the document - the associate whose checklist the document is in. 
<para>Use MDO List name "associate" to get list items.</para>

Contact.description:
The contact associated with the document. It may also be null if no contact is associated with the document. 
<para>Use MDO List name "contact" to get list items.</para>

Project.description:
A document may also be connected to a project, so you see the document both on the company card, and on the project card. This does not mean however that a project is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "project" to get list items.</para>

ExternalRef.description: External reference for document plugin to resolve document identity (Notes ID, e-mail message ID, whatever)

Completed.description: Document Completed state. This is the part of the Status property.

ActiveLinks.description: Number of active links to sale, document, appointment.

Type.description: Is this a normal document or a mail-merge or report?

Links.description: List of all elements linked to the document.

Sale.description:
A document may also be connected to a sale, so you see the document on the company card, on the project card and on the sale card. This does not mean however that a sale is required. May be null. 
<para>Use MDO List name "sale" to get list items.</para>

SuggestedDocumentId.description: Suggested guide item that this document is an instance of (Note: NOT valid for appointments, they have their own link)

Snum.description: The sequence number allocated from refcount on used template when creating the document

UserDefinedFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.CustomFields} instead.
Dictionary of user defined field data.
The key string is the ProgId of the UdefField, or if the ProgId is empty it is a string of the format "SuperOffice:[UdefFieldIdentity]", e.g. "SuperOffice:1234"

ExtraFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.CustomFields} instead.
Extra fields added to the carrier. This could be data from Plug-ins, the foreign key system, external applications, etc.

CustomFields.description:
Udef + Extra fields added to the carrier. Extra fields as defined by changes to database schema + user-defined fields as defined by admin.
Custom fields combines user defined fields and extra fields into one bucket. 
The individual {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.ExtraFields} and <see cref="P:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.UserDefinedFields">UserDefinedFields</see> properties are deprecated in favor of this
combined collection.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Address.description:
Street and/or Postal address, in both formatted and structured forms. You only need to modify one of the two for the change to be registered.
<para />
Carrier object for Address.

Wgs84Latitude.description: Latitude (that's north/south), decimal degrees, relative to WGS 84 ellipsoid. SuperOffice ASA is at 59.91892. This value needs no further grid reference or other qualifying information.

Wgs84Longitude.description: Longitude (that's East/west), decimal degrees, relative to WGS 84 ellipsoid. SuperOffice ASA is at 10.73159. This value needs no further grid reference or other qualifying information.

LocalizedAddress.description: LocalizedFieldArray is a list of LocalizedFieldList objects. Used to store localized information such as formatted address data.

Street.description: Street address (company street, person address, delivery address). LocalizedAddress changes override this property, so you do not have to change both Localized and this.

Postal.description: Postal address (company postal, billing address). LocalizedAddress changes override this property, so you do not have to change both Localized and this.

Formatted.description:
Read-only formatted address multi-line string. Combines street and postal into one string. e.g.: <c>"Postboks 123,
Brugata 123,
1234 OSLO
"</c> or <c>"Postbox 123,
Bridgelane 123,
West Tooting,
East Shire ES2 W31
"</c>.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

Formatted.description:
Read-only formatted address multi-line string. e.g.: <c>"Brugata 123,
1234 OSLO
"</c> or <c>"Bridgelane 123,
West Tooting,
The Shire ES2 W31
"</c>.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.DocumentC.description: GetDocumentStreamFromEntity: Get the document as a stream

SetDocumentStream: Store a document's contents from its stream. Since there is a potential for a name conflict (the file name stored by the document entity earlier may prove to be invalid), the (possibly amended) document entity is returned. The client should not assume that any earlier, cached entity information is valid.
CreateDocumentStream: Creates a new Stream that can be used to store the document in the file archive.
GetTemplateStream: Retrieve a stream to a mail template based on its name
GetSanitizedTemplateStream: Retrieve a stream to a mail template based on its name. Sanitizes the contents if possible.
GetTemplateStreamFromId: Retrieve a stream to a document template based on its id
GetSanitizedTemplateStreamFromId: Retrieve a stream to a document template based on its id. Sanitizes the contents if possible.
GetDocumentStream: Get the document content as a stream
GetSanitizedDocumentStream: Get the document content as a stream. Retrieves a sanitized version if possible
GetPreviewDocumentStream: Get the preview version of the document content as a stream. Retrieves a sanitized version if possible

GetUnsanitizedPreviewDocumentStream: Get the preview version of the document content as a stream. Retrieves an unsanitized version. This has less CPU impact but the caller must sanitize the content before presenting it to the user.

CreateNewPhysicalMailMergeDocumentFromTemplate: Create a new physical document based on the documents template. Do not replace template tags, as the document is going to be used as a mail merge source. Use GetDocumentStream to obtain the created documents. Since there is a potential for a name conflict (the file name stored by the document entity earlier may prove to be invalid), the (possibly amended) document entity is returned. The client should not assume that any earlier, cached entity information is valid.

CreateNewPhysicalDocumentFromTemplateWithCustomTags: Create a new physical document based on a document template and store it in the document archive.  Tags are substituted according to the provided id's.  Use GetDocumentStream to obtain the created document content. Since there is a potential for a name conflict (the file name stored by the document entity earlier may prove to be invalid), the (possibly amended) document entity is returned. The client should not assume that any earlier, cached entity information is valid.

CreateNewPhysicalDocumentFromTemplateWithCustomTags2: Create a new physical document based on a document template and store it in the document archive.  Tags are substituted according to the provided id's.  Use GetDocumentStream to obtain the created document content. Since there is a potential for a name conflict (the file name stored by the document entity earlier may prove to be invalid), the (possibly amended) document entity is returned. The client should not assume that any earlier, cached entity information is valid.
SubstituteTemplateVariables: Parse the source string, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the ID's given in the other parameters.

SubstituteTemplateVariablesWithCustomTags: Parse the source string, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the ID's given in the other parameters.<p/>This method also takes a pair of arrays specifying custom tags and their values; these tags will be available during substitution in addition to all the existing tags. Custom values will override values otherwise set.

SubstituteTemplateVariablesWithCustomTags2: Parse the source string, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the ID's given in the other parameters.<p/>This method also takes a pair of arrays specifying custom tags and their values; these tags will be available during substitution in addition to all the existing tags. Custom values will override values otherwise set.
CreateTempFile: Create a new temporary file based on the provided stream.  Specified filename may be overridden, and actual name is returned.
GetTempFile: Get data stream for temporary file created with CreateTempFile.
DeleteTempFile: Delete a temporary file created with CreateTempFile.
SetTemplateStream: Save a mail signature template to the document archive

CreateNewPhysicalDocumentFromTemplate: Create a new document content based on a document template and store it in the document archive.  Tags are substituted according to the provided id's.  Use GetDocumentStream to obtain the created document. Since there is a potential for a name conflict (the file name stored by the document entity earlier may prove to be invalid), the (possibly amended) document entity is returned. The client should not assume that any earlier, cached entity information is valid.

SubstituteMergeDocumentTemplateVariables: Parse the source document, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the associate Id.<p/> The source document should be of type MergeDraft. This method also takes a pair of arrays specifying custom tags and their values; these tags will be available during substitution in addition to all the existing tags. Custom values will override values otherwise set.

SubstituteMergeDocumentTemplateVariables2: Parse the source document, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the associate Id.<p/> The source document should be of type MergeDraft. This method also takes a pair of arrays specifying custom tags and their values; these tags will be available during substitution in addition to all the existing tags. Custom values will override values otherwise set.

SubstituteTemplateVariablesEx: Parse the source string, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the identities, custom values and entities specified in the other parameters.
VerifyGetDocumentStream: Verify that the requested document stream exists, and that we can access it, without actually getting the stream.

SubstituteMergeDocumentTemplateVariablesEx: Parse the source document, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the provided identifiers.<p/> The source document should be of type MergeDraft. This method also takes a pair of arrays specifying custom tags and their values; these tags will be available during substitution in addition to all the existing tags. Custom values will override values otherwise set.

SubstituteMergeDocumentTemplateVariablesEx2: Parse the source document, and replace any template variable tags with their values, based on the provided identifiers.<p/> The source document should be of type MergeDraft. This method also takes a pair of arrays specifying custom tags and their values; these tags will be available during substitution in addition to all the existing tags. Custom values will override values otherwise set.

GetDocumentUrl: Get a URL referring to the given document content.<para/>This URL may be passed to the ultimate client (text editor of some kind?), which is then responsible for all further operations.<para/>The returned string is a fully qualified URL.<para/>Not all documents and document plugins support this feature.
DeletePhysicalDocument: Delete the document contents
RenameDocument: Rename the physical document, i.e., change the file name or equivalent concept in the document archive.
GetCheckoutState: Get the current checkout state for a document, relative to the user perforing the call.
CheckoutDocument: Check out a document for editing by the current user.
CheckinDocument: Check in a currently checked-out document
UndoCheckoutDocument: Undo (abandon) a checkout
GetVersionList: Get a list of existing, committed  versions for a given document

GetPluginCapabilities: Get a list of plugin-dependent capabilities for a given document archive plugin.<br/>A standard set of properties is defined in SuperOffice.CRM.Documents.Constants.Capabilities.

GetDocumentProperties: Get plugin-dependent properties for the document. A number of standard properties that should be supported by all plugins are defined in SuperOffice.CRM.Documents.Constants.Properties.
GetDocumentCommands: Get a list of custom commands valid for the specific document at this time. This information should not be cached by clients, as it may change between documents and over time.
ExecuteDocumentCommand: Execute a custom command on a particular document, optionally a particular version
CreateDefaultDocumentEntityFromSuggestion:
SaveDocumentTemplateStream: Saves content in stream to document template file

SetDocumentStreamFromId: Store document content from stream. Since there is a potential for a name conflict (the file name stored by the document entity earlier may prove to be invalid), the (possibly amended) document entity is returned. The client should not assume that any earlier, cached entity information is valid.
SavePrivacyReport: Generates a Pdf from HTML and makes a document
ValidateDocumentEntity: Check that entity is ready for saving, return error messages by field.
GetDocumentLength: Get length of the document content in bytes.
CopyDocumentToCsAttachment: Copy a crm document to cs attachemnt. For use in mailings
SavePrivacyReportPdf: Saves a pdf stream, assigns file name, connects to given contact etc.
GetAppointmentDocuments: Get all documents that are linked to the appointment. I.e. the documents that are listed in the appointment dialog.
GetSaleDocuments: Get all documents that are linked to the sale. I.e. the documents that are listed in the sale dialog.
GetPersonDocuments: Get all documents that are linked to the person. I.e. the documents that are listed in the person dialog.
GetPublishedDocument: Get the document if it's published
GetPublishedDocuments: Get the published documents from an array of doucment ids.

GetPublishedDocumentsByDate: Method that returns a specified number of published document appointments within a time range. The document appointments is visible to the person specified or the document is in a project the person belongs to.

GetContactDocumentsByTemplateTypes: Method that returns a specified number of document appointments within a time range, filtered by document template types. The document appointments belong to the contact specified.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.
